Elia","username":"Traptricker","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/traptricker/{size}/215403_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-12T18:25:55.662Z","cooked":"\u003cp\u003eIf you use \u003ca href=\"https://github.wpilib.org/allwpilib/docs/release/java/edu/wpi/first/math/estimator/SwerveDrivePoseEstimator.html\" rel=\"noopener nofollow ugc\"\u003eSwerveDrivePoseEstimator\u003c/a\u003e it extends \u003ca href=\"https://github.wpilib.org/allwpilib/docs/release/java/edu/wpi/first/math/estimator/PoseEstimator.html\" rel=\"noopener nofollow ugc\"\u003ePoseEstimator\u003c/a\u003e you can use the method  \u003ccode\u003eaddVisionMeasurement\u003c/code\u003e. You can also add you swerve drive wheel positions with the methods \u003ccode\u003eupdate\u003c/code\u003e or \u003ccode\u003eupdateWithTime\u003c/code\u003e. This class “fuses” the data together like you want, getting you a more realistic estimated pose.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eI recommend looking at \u003ca href=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TG9KAa2EGzQ\" rel=\"noopener nofollow ugc\"\u003ethis video\u003c/a\u003e and or \u003ca href=\"https://github.com/STMARobotics/frc-7028-2023/blob/5916bb426b97f10e17d9dfd5ec6c3b6fda49a7ce/src/main/java/frc/robot/subsystems/PoseEstimatorSubsystem.java\" rel=\"noopener nofollow ugc\"\u003ethis code\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eBut basically, once you make a \u003ccode\u003eSwerveDrivePoseEstimator\u003c/code\u003e, you want to update it with your swerve module positions as often as you can (so probably every periodic) and update it with your Limelight pose estimates as often as they get new measurements. If you have two limelights, you can just use \u003ccode\u003eaddVisionMeasurement\u003c/code\u003e twice, once for each of
